trans-unit.source: Represents the maximum number of connections to a remote computer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement"></xref> class with the specified address and connection limit information.

This constructor sets the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.Address%2A> property to `address` and the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.MaxConnection%2A> property to `maxConnection`.
A string that identifies the address of a remote computer.
An integer that identifies the maximum number of connections allowed to `address` from the local computer.
Gets or sets the address for remote computers.
You can set this property using an asterisk (*) to set the default number of connections for unspecified computers.

This property identifies one or more remote computers and the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.MaxConnection%2A> property specifies how many simultaneous connections are allowed between the local computer and the remote computers.
A string that contains a regular expression describing an IP address or DNS name.
Gets or sets the maximum number of connections that can be made to a remote computer.
This property specifies how many simultaneous connections are allowed between the local computer and the remote computer.
The remote computer is specified using the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.Address%2A> property.

If an application is not changing <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> from the default, then the MaxConnection property applies to the entire application domain.
If only a single application domain is running in your application, then the MaxConnection property setting is application-wide.
An integer that specifies the maximum number of connections.
